First Name King Full Name at Birth King Wallis Vidor Alternative Name King Wallis Vidor, King Vidor, King W. Vidor Birthday 8th February, 1894 Birthplace Galveston, Texas USA Died 1st November, 1982 Place of Death Paseo Robles, CA USA Cause of Death Natural Causes Buried Cremated, Ashes scattered Height 5' 11½" (182 cm) Build Athletic Eye Color Hazel Hair Color Brown - Dark Zodiac Sign Aquarius Sexuality Straight Religion Christian Science Ethnicity White Nationality American Occupation Text Film director, producer, screenwriter Occupation Director Claim to Fame The Big Parade, The Crowd, Show People Year(s) Active 1913–1980, 1913–1980 Friend Victor Fleming, Arthur Freed, Colleen Moore, John Gilbert

King Wallis Vidor (; February 8, 1894 – November 1, 1982) was an American film director, film producer, and screenwriter whose 67-year film-making career successfully spanned the silent and sound eras. His works are distinguished by a vivid, humane, and sympathetic depiction of contemporary social issues. Considered an auteur director, Vidor approached multiple genres and allowed the subject matter to determine the style, often pressing the limits of film-making conventions.
